SEARCH
Package com.mycompany.assignment

Class LogicAndDatabase

java.lang.Object
com.mycompany.assignment.LogicAndDatabase
public class LogicAndDatabase extends Object
Provides logic and functionalities related to managing subscriptions and databases. This class includes methods for selecting default supplements and magazines.

  • Constructor Details

    • LogicAndDatabase

      public LogicAndDatabase()
      Constructs a LogicAndDatabase object.

  • Method Details

    • defaultSelectionSupplememnt

      public static List<Supplement> defaultSelectionSupplememnt()
      Prompts the user to select default supplements.
      Returns:
      A list of selected default supplements.

    • defaultSelectionMagazine

      public static List<Magazine> defaultSelectionMagazine()
      Prompts the user to select default magazines along with their associated supplements.
      Returns:
      A list of selected default magazines.

    • database

      public static void database()
      Manages the database by creating subscriptions and populating them with customers, magazines, and supplements.

    • redirect

      public static void redirect()
      This method redirects the user to various options based on their choice. The user is prompted to enter a choice between 1 and 11. Depending on the choice, different actions are executed such as calling specific functions or exiting the loop.

    • option1

      public static void option1()
      Displays all the paying customers along with their associated customers' names and emails.

    • option2

      public static void option2()
      Allows the user to add a new paying customer. The user is prompted to enter details such as name, email, payment method, bank, magazines, supplements, and associated customers.

    • option3

      public static void option3()
      Removes a paying customer or an associated customer of a paying customer.

    • option4

      public static void option4()
      This method allows a paying customer to add an associate customer to their subscription. It prompts the user to select a paying customer from the list of paying customers, then prompts for details of the associate customer to be added. Once the details are provided, the associate customer is added to the selected paying customer's subscription.

    • option5

      public static void option5()
      This method allows a paying customer to remove an associate customer from their subscription. It prompts the user to select a paying customer from the list of paying customers, then lists out the associated customers for the selected paying customer. The user can then select an associated customer to remove from the subscription.

    • option6

      public static void option6()
      This method allows a user to add a magazine to a customer's subscription. It prompts the user to select a customer, then choose whether to add the magazine to the paying customer's subscription or one of their associate customers' subscriptions. Depending on the selection, the user is prompted to select the specific customer and then either choose a magazine from their list of magazines or input details for a new magazine.

    • option7

      public static void option7()
      This method allows a user to remove a magazine from a customer's subscription. It prompts the user to select a customer, then choose whether to remove the magazine from the paying customer's subscription or one of their associate customers' subscriptions. Depending on the selection, the user is prompted to select the specific customer and then choose a magazine from their list of magazines to remove.

    • option8

      public static void option8()
      This method allows a user to add a supplement to a customer's subscription. It prompts the user to select a customer, then choose whether to add the supplement to the paying customer's subscription or one of their associate customers' subscriptions. Depending on the selection, the user is prompted to select the specific customer and then choose whether to add the supplement inside a magazine or as a standalone supplement.

    • option9

      public static void option9()
      This method allows a user to remove a supplement from a customer's subscription. It prompts the user to select a customer, then choose whether to remove the supplement from the paying customer's subscription or one of their associate customers' subscriptions. Depending on the selection, the user is prompted to select the specific customer and then choose whether to remove a standalone supplement or a supplement from within a magazine.

    • option10

      public static void option10()
      This method displays the weekly notifications for a selected customer. It prompts the user to select a customer (either a paying customer or one of their associates), then displays the weekly notifications for that customer for four weeks.

    • option11

      public static void option11()
      This method displays the monthly notifications for a selected paying customer. It prompts the user to select a paying customer, then displays the monthly notifications for that customer.

    • option12

      public static void option12()
      This method prints out the text of all the emails for all customers for four weeks of magazines. It iterates through all paying customers and their associate customers, displaying the weekly notifications for each of them for four weeks.

    • option13

      public static void option13()
      This method displays the monthly notifications for all paying customers. It iterates through all paying customers and displays the monthly notifications for each of them.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] arg)
      Main method to start the program.
      Parameters:
      arg - The command-line arguments passed to the program.
